bLoop:
Determines whether the created spline is a loop. This can be toggled using "Closed Loop" in
the detail panel after spline creation.
OutputMode: Determines how the resulting spline is emitted on tool accept.
TargetActor: Actor to attach to when Output Mode is "Existing Actor"
BlueprintToCreate: Blueprint to create when Output Mode is "Create Blueprint"
ExistingSplineIndexToReplace:
When attaching to an existing actor or creating a blueprint, controls whether the drawn
spline replaces one of the target's existing components or gets added as a new one (if
the index is out of bounds).
DrawMode: How the spline is drawn in the tool.
MinPointSpacing: Point spacing when Draw Mode is "Free Draw"
ClickOffset: How far to offset spline points from the clicked surface, along the surface normal
OffsetMethod: How to choose the direction to offset points from the clicked surface
OffsetDirection: Manually-specified click offset direction. Note: Will be normalized. If it is a zero vector, a default Up vector will be used instead.
FrameVisualizationWidth:
When nonzero, allows a visualization of the rotation of the spline. Can be controlled
in the detail panel after creation via "Scale Visualization Width" property.
UpVectorMode:
How the spline rotation is set. It is suggested to use a nonzero FrameVisualizationWidth to
see the effects.
bPreviewUsingActorCopy:
When modifying existing actors, whether the result should be previewed using a copy
of that actor (rather than just drawing the spline by itself). Could be toggled off
if something about duplicating the given actor is problematic.
bHitWorld: Whether to place spline points on the surface of objects in the world
bHitCustomPlane: Whether to place spline points on a custom, user-adjustable plane
bHitGroundPlanes: Whether to place spline points on a plane through the origin aligned with the Z axis in perspective views, or facing the camera in othographic views
bRerunConstructionScriptOnDrag:
If modifying a blueprint actor, whether to run the construction script while dragging
or only at the end of a drag. Can be toggled off for expensive construction scripts.
